block.p: Deborah Susan Hellman and Derek Stephen Brown were married yesterday at the Friends Meeting House in Washington. Judge Andre M. Davis of the Federal District Court in Baltimore officiated.

Ms. Hellman, 36, is keeping her name. She is an associate professor of law at the University of Maryland at Baltimore. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received a master's degree in philosophy from Columbia University and a law degree from Harvard.
Deborah Susan Hellman and Derek Stephen Brown were married yesterday at the Friends Meeting House in Washington. Judge Andre M. Davis of the Federal District Court in Baltimore officiated.

Ms. Hellman, 36, is keeping her name. She is an associate professor of law at the University of Maryland at Baltimore. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received a master's degree in philosophy from Columbia University and a law degree from Harvard.

She is the daughter of Marcia Hellman and Dr. Samuel Hellman of Chicago. Her mother is a consultant in human resources at the University of Chicago. Her father, an oncologist and former dean of the university's School of Medicine, is the A. N. Pritzger distinguished service professor there. From 1983 to 1988, he was the physician in chief at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in New York.

Mr. Brown, 39, is the vice president for global fellowship at Ashoka Innovators for the Public, an Arlington, Va., nonprofit organization that provides aid for social services at the local level in developing countries. He graduated from Yale and received an M.B.A. degree from Stanford.

His parents, Norma and Corrick Brown, live in Santa Rosa, Calif. His father is the chairman of Corrick's, a department store there. The elder Mr. Brown was also the music director of the Santa Rosa Symphony from 1957 to 1995. The bridegroom's mother, a pianist, plays with chamber groups in Santa Rosa.
